newsitem.title: USA: Hollywood stars Pitt, Paltrow break off engagement.
newsitem.headline: Hollywood stars Pitt, Paltrow break off engagement.

text.p: Movie stars Brad Pitt and Gwyneth Paltrow have broken off their engagement, Pitt's publicist said on Tuesday.

Pitt, who starred in the recently released "The Devil's Own" and received an Oscar nomination for "12 Monkeys", and Paltrow, who made a splash in last year's "Emma," had been expected to marry shortly.
But in a terse statement publicist Cindy Guagenti said, "Brad Pitt and Gwyneth Paltrow have mutually agreed to end their two-and-a-half-year relationship."

Pitt, 32, and Paltrow, 24, met on the set of "Seven" two years ago and were engaged in November. They are scheduled to appear together in the comedy "Duet," directed by Paltrow's father, Bruce, with filming to start in September.
Guagenti declined to elaborate on her statement, but she was quoted by the New York Post as saying, "They have been broken up for a couple of weeks now. It's not because of any specific event."
A source told the Post that the party-loving Pitt seemed to feel hemmed in by Paltrow's preference for quieter fun.
